subject: Re: [junit] JUnit licensing issues
msgSnippet: I thought GPL is open source, Guddu http://techtips.ontheweb.com ... __________________________________ Do you Yahoo!? The New Yahoo! Search - Faster. Easier.
messageBody:
I thought GPL is open source,

Guddu
http://techtips.ontheweb.com

--- spam_if_you_want_to
<spam_if_you_want_to@...> wrote:
> I am currently developing a program and using JUnit
> for testing. I
> would like to release my program under the GPL
> license. The GPL is
> not compatible with JUnit's CPL license, but the
> Free Software
> Foundation have told me that I can insert an
> exception into my GPL to
> allow linking against CPLed libraries. However,
> they warned me that I
> might still be violating the CPL if I do this.
>
> So, can I link my GPLed program against JUnit? If
> not I will have to
> strip out all the tests before I release.
>
>
